detaileddescription.para:
Refresh the position and size of the scroll bars.
page
pointer to a page object

Handle the drawing related tasks of the pages
page
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Handle the drawing related tasks of the scrollable object
scrl
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Signal function of the page
page
pointer to a page object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Signal function of the scrollable part of a page
scrl
pointer to the scrollable object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Propagate the input device related event of the scrollable to the parent page background It is used by default if the scrollable's event is not specified
scrl
pointer to the page's scrollable object
event
type of the event
data
data of the event

Create a page objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new page
copy
pointer to a page object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created page

Delete all children of the scrl object, without deleting scrl child.
obj
pointer to an object

Set the scroll bar mode on a page
page
pointer to a page object
sb_mode
the new mode from 'lv_page_sb.mode_t' enum

Enable/Disable scrolling with arrows if the page is in group (arrows: LV_KEY_LEFT/RIGHT/UP/DOWN)
page
pointer to a page object
en
true: enable scrolling with arrows

Enable the scroll propagation feature. If enabled then the page will move its parent if there is no more space to scroll.
page
pointer to a Page
en
true or false to enable/disable scroll propagation

Enable the edge flash effect. (Show an arc when the an edge is reached)
page
pointer to a Page
en
true or false to enable/disable end flash

Set a style of a page
page
pointer to a page object
type
which style should be set
style
pointer to a style

Get the scrollable object of a page
page
pointer to a page object
pointer to a container which is the scrollable part of the page

Set the scroll bar mode on a page
page
pointer to a page object
the mode from 'lv_page_sb.mode_t' enum

Get the the scrolling with arrows (LV_KEY_LEFT/RIGHT/UP/DOWN) is enabled or not
page
pointer to a page object
true: scrolling with arrows is enabled

Get the scroll propagation property
page
pointer to a Page
true or false

Get the edge flash effect property.
page
pointer to a Page return true or false

Get that width which can be set to the children to still not cause overflow (show scrollbars)
page
pointer to a page object
the width which still fits into the page

Get that height which can be set to the children to still not cause overflow (show scrollbars)
page
pointer to a page object
the height which still fits into the page

Get a style of a page
page
pointer to page object
type
which style should be get
style pointer to a style

Find whether the page has been scrolled to a certain edge.
page
Page object
edge
Edge to check
true if the page is on the specified edge

Glue the object to the page. After it the page can be moved (dragged) with this object too.
obj
pointer to an object on a page
glue
true: enable glue, false: disable glue

Focus on an object. It ensures that the object will be visible on the page.
page
pointer to a page object
obj
pointer to an object to focus (must be on the page)
anim_time
scroll animation time in milliseconds (0: no animation)

Scroll the page horizontally
page
pointer to a page object
dist
the distance to scroll (< 0: scroll right; > 0 scroll left)

Scroll the page vertically
page
pointer to a page object
dist
the distance to scroll (< 0: scroll down; > 0 scroll up)

Not intended to use directly by the user but by other object types internally. Start an edge flash animation. Exactly one ext->edge_flash.xxx_ip should be set
page
